Ombudsman directs bank to pay Rs 28,000.description: Raipur: A bank dispute involving refund of money fraudulently withdrawn from a customer's bank account in Dhamtari was resolved with intervention of Chhattisgarh Banking Ombudsman. The complainant Sunil Kumar Bagwan hails from Dewas and is currently living in Delhi. He lodged a complaint with the Chhattisgarh Banking Ombudsman stating that a sum of Rs 28,300 was fraudulently withdrawn from his bank account in February this year. He also stated that he has been trying to resolve the problem through the customer care service of a nationalised bank since last three months but was not getting a proper response from their side. As per the ombudsman orders, a conciliation meeting was held and the matter was put up before the Banking Ombudsman in Raipur K Korkora. The customer and a four-member team of the bank including the branch manager attended the meeting. In the meeting, the bank agreed to credit the amount along with the interest by June 10. Both the complainant and the bank officials agreed with the decision. Bagwan told TOI that he was living in Dhamtari for the last six years and had opened an account in the Dhamtari branch of the bank. On February 23, he received a message on his mobile regarding withdrawal of Rs 13,700 which he never made. "I tried to contact the bank several times and also tried to register a complaint with bank's toll-free-number. However, the customer service executive told me that they cannot track the fraud transaction," he said. Two days later, he received another message regarding withdrawal of Rs 14,800 from his account. He again contacted the bank's toll-free-number and registered a complaint and got the same reply from the bank. "I tried to register my complaint many times. But the bank officials asked me baseless questions," he said. After repeated complaints, the bank generated a token numbers for both the complaints. Meanwhile, the consumer also registered a police complaint. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BSP List 2019 UP.description: LUCKNOW: The BSP on Friday announced its first list of 11 candidates for the Lok Sabha elections 2019, fielding JD(S) turncoat Kunwar Danish Ali from Amroha. Ali, who was general secretary of the Janata Dal-Secular, quit the party and joined the Bahujan Samaj Party only last week. The BSP also declared Haji Fazulrahman its nominee from Saharanpur, Malook Nagar from Bijnore and Girish Chandra from Nagina, a party release said. Hazi Mohammad Yakoob has been fielded from Meerut, Satbeer Nagar from Gautam Buddh Nagar, Yogesh Verma from Bulandshahr, Ajit Baliyan from Aligarh, Manoj Kumar Soni from Agra, Rajveer Singh from Fatehpur Sikri and Ruchi Veera from Aonla. Mayawati's BSP is contesting 38 of the 80 Lok Sabha constituencies in Uttar Pradesh under the seat-sharing arrangement with Samajwadi Party and the Rashtriya Lok Dal. Maharashtra Lok Sabha Constituencies.description: MUMBAI: Maharashtra, which has 48 parliamentary constituencies, will go to polls in four phases, starting April 11. In 2009 and 2014, Lok Sabha elections were held in three phases in Maharashtra On April 11, seven constituencies in Maharashtra’s Vidarbha region will go to polls - Nagpur, Wardha, Yavatmal-Washim, and the naxal-affected areas of Gadchiroli and Chandrapur. In the second phase on April 18, 10 constituencies - including three constituencies in Vidarbha, six in Marathwada and Solapur in western Maharashtra - go to elections. The third phase, on April 23, of polling will be held in Pune, Baramati, Jalgaon, Jalna, Aurangabad, Raigad and Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg, Sangli, Satara and Kolhapur. In the final phase on April 29, all six constituencies in Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Palghar and Bhiwandi will go to polls among the total 17 seats in the state. KEY CONSTITUENCIESAmong the key constituencies are Baramati and Nagpur featuring high-profile candidates such as Supriya Sule and Nitin Gadkari. Then there is Ahmednagar from where Sujay Vikhe Patil, son of senior Congress leader Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil, is contesting. Other important constituencies are Jalna, Chandrapur, Dhule, Beed, Sangli, Mumbai North Central, Mumbai North and Baramati.    CONSTITUENCIES CONTENDERS   Chandrapur Union MoS Hansraj Ahir (BJP); Suresh Dhanorkar (Congress)   Baramati Kanchan Kul (BJP); Supriya Sule (Congress)   Jalna State BJP chief Raosaheb Danve BJP; Vilas Keshavrao Autade (Congress)   Akola Sanjay Dhotre (BJP); Hidayat Patel (Congress)   Bhiwandi Kapil Patil(BJP); Suresh Kashinath Taware (Congress)    Nagpur Union minister Nitin Gadkari (BJP)   Ahmednagar Sujay Vikhe Patil (BJP)   Dhule Union MoS for defence Subash Bhamre (BJP)    Beed Late BJP MP Gopinath Munde’s daughter Pritam (BJP); Bajrang Sonawane (NCP)   Sangli Sitting MP Sanjay Patil (BJP)    Mumbai North Central Poonam Mahajan (BJP)    Aurangabad Subhash Zambad (Congress)   Gadchiroli Ashok Nete (BJP)   Mumbai North Gopal Shetty (BJP)    Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Priyanka Gandhi.description: RAE BARELI: In her scathing attack on BJP and Modi government, Congress general secretary Priyanka Gandhi said that Congress doesn't need any certificate from anyone to prove its nationalist feelings. "Ye brashtachar ki baat karnewale sabse bade brashta hain… kaam ki baat karte hain magar sabse bade nikamme hain… dharma ki baat karne wale sabse bada adharm kar rahe hain - dharm ka istemal kar rahe hain… saheedon ka istemal kar rahe hain - sirf rajinit ke liye (They are talking of acting against corruption but are corrupt themselves… they talk of work but are good for nothing… they talk of dharma (read duties) but indulge in adharma by defying its norms - they use religion and martyrs for political interests)," Priyanka stated in her closed door meeting with cadres on Thursday. The Congress leader hit out at BJP's strategy of playing the nationalist card. "We are Congress… we launched the freedom movement… gave our blood and sweat… braved British atrocities … we don't need any certificate to prove our nationalist feelings especially from the ones who apologised to the British at that time", asserted Priyanka, urging the workers to go to every household in their area and meet every voter. She directed the workers to apprise the voters that the 2019 Lok Sabha election was as important as the freedom movement. Infusing energy in them she said, "Don't be afraid of anything as this is a weak government. Only a weak government curbs the voice of the people, which is a crime in democracy." Priyanka asked the workers to stand up for their leader whose only dream is the progress of India and its people. "Rahul thinks of the people without any vested interest," Priyanka said citing the example of her conversation with Rahul on the issue of using self-help group women for campaigning. "When I proposed to him this idea, he simply denied… saying that I created the SHGs to empower women, not use them in any way," Priyanka said quoting her brother. The Congress general secretary told the workers that she was working on mission 2022. "We will, with your support, form the government in 2022. And once we come, we will stay here for long on the basis of our hard work," she said adding that the hard-workers would be adequately rewarded. \nBeautiful flower and vegetable display.description: People of Chhattisgarh enjoyed an amazingly wide variety of flowers and art work from vegetables and rangolis on Sunday morning at Maitri Bagh, Bhilai. The display included 300 varieties of roses including some unique ones like black lady rose, dutch rose and Kashmir rose. The event marked thousands of visitors from all over the state. Gardening enthusiasts were seen enquiring about the varieties and maintenance techniques. Some of them even bought a few varieties that were up for sale.  “The floral display stands are beautifully arranged and well-maintained. It’s not often that you get to see such rare varieties of flowers. I particularly liked the bird-shaped figure made from flowers. It’s all very informative and helpful,”says Mansi Thakur, a 46-year-old, homemaker.  While bouquet making and salad decoration competitions on the day gave people a perfect platform to show their creativity, 3-D rangolis put out in the main lawn giving a social message (save the girl child) attracted many. The cultural events going on throughout the day kept the visitors involved.  “It’s for the first time I saw such magnificent rangolis.The concept of 3-D rangolis is actually great, it’s the hard work of artists. I even got to pick some ideas of salad decoration that I can experiment with at home,” says Trishla Khare, a final year B.com student. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

40-year-old woman raped at knifepoint.description: RAIPUR: A 40-year-old woman was raped by a man at knifepoint in the outskirts of the city. The woman, a resident of Telghani Naka region of Raipur, said the incident took place on May 25 when she was returning from a ration shop. Accused Gopal Sahu, 45, who lives in her neighbourhood, approached her and asked her to sit on his bike. When she refused, he threatened her on knifepoint and kidnapped her. Sahu then drove her to Nandanvan in the outskirts of city and raped her, police said. She told police that Sahu then threatened her of dire consequences before abandoning her. She somehow made her way back home by around 11 at night. The woman kept mum for a few days but then informed her husband about the incident. A case was lodged on Friday at Azad Nagar police station thereafter after which accused Sahu was arrested the very same day. Police said that the accused, who works as a labourer, abducted her from a crowded place. In another incident reported from Bhilai in Durg district, a married woman, who is mentally unwell and was abandoned by her husband, was gang-raped by two persons on Thursday including the brother of a village sarpanch and his driver. The woman, who has two children, was living with her parents and was alone at home when the accused sneaked inside.The two accused were drunk and had been keeping an eye on the woman's activities. When the woman was left alone at home, they approached her on the pretext of filling some residential documents. After the duo entered the house, the woman tried to resist their advances. The accused then beat her up and raped her. When the accused saw the woman's mother returning home, the two fled the spot. The woman then narrated the ordeal to her parents and a case was lodged against the two. Police launched a search following which they were arrested late on Friday.The accused were identified as Leeladhar Chaturvedi, the village sarpanch's brother, and driver Balakdas Baghel. FIR filed against NRI for blackmailing K.description: RAIPUR: A Korba woman filed a complaint against an NRI — who she had met to arrange a marriage in December — for blackmailing and harassing her not to marry another man. Police said, the accused is a resident of Fatehpur in Uttar Pradesh and works in Saudi Arabia. The woman and the accused had met in December via a wedding agent. The two struck a friendship and later decided to marry each other. During their time together, the accused had clicked personal photographs and recorded videos of the woman with her consent. He left saying that he would return and fix the wedding date. The accused returned to Saudi Arabia and the two continued to stay in touch. The woman’s parents, however, were getting restless as the accused had postponed his plans to return for marriage. After four months of no clear response, the parents decided to find another match for their daughter. The woman informed the accused, saying that she will abide by her parents’ wishes and marry whoever they choose for her. This infuriated him and he started blackmailing the woman. He threatened to post her pictures and videos on social media. Afraid of his threats, the woman spoke to the accused’s mother to ask her son to not circulate the pictures. Instead, the accused’s mother insulted her, the woman told police. Within a day, the woman’s pictures went viral on WhatsApp groups, Facebook and other social media sites. The woman told her parents and reported the matter to the police. Police said, the accused first sent the photo to the woman’s relatives through which she learnt that her photographs had gone viral. An FIR has been lodged against the accused and further investigation is underway, said police. In a similar incident, a driver working for a family clicked objectionable photographs of a woman in his employer’s house and used them to blackmail her. He allegedly raped her for two years threatening to share the photographs. Fed up, the woman complained to her husband, recently, and the two decided to file an FIR. Police said, two years ago, when the woman’s husband was out of station that driver had sneakily clicked objectionable pictures of the woman. He used them to rape her repeatedly over the course of two years, said police. The accused has been arrested. The names of the accused have been withheld to protect the identity of the women. BJP List 2019 Tamilnadu.description: CHENNAI: The BJP's Tamil Nadu candidates list announced on Thursday was on expected lines, with Union minister Pon Radhakrishnan being fielded from Kanyakumari, state chief Tamilisai Soundararajan in Tuticorin, national secretary H Raja in Sivaganga, C P Radhakrishnan in Coimbatore and vice-president Nainar Nagendran in Ramanathapuram. While Pon Radhakrishnan and Raja will fight Congress, which is yet to name candidates for its nine seats in DMK alliance, Tamilisai will cross swords with DMK heavyweight Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. H Raja to contest from Sivaganga for third timeH Raja is contesting from Sivaganga for the third time. In 2014, he came third with 1.33 lakh votes, while in 1999, he came second. It will be a keenly fought battle between Tamilisai and DMK’s state women wing secretary and Rajya Sabha MP K Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. Though Tamilisai initially preferred to contest from Chennai South, which has a sizeable votebank for the party, she finally settled for Tuticorin. AIADMK was keen on retaining south Chennai for sitting MP, J Jayavardhan, son of fisheries minister D Jayakumar. Former TN BJP chief Radhakrishnan will face CPM’s P R Natarajan in Coimbatore. This is the fifth time that Radhakrishnan has been fielded in Coimbatore, a BJP stronghold. While he won two consecutive Lok Sabha elections in 1998 and 1999, he was defeated in the 2004 and 2014 polls. Nainar Nagendran has been pitted against DMK’s IUML candidate K Nawaz Kani. While the party made a quick decision on candidates for four constituencies, Ramanathapuram delayed matters considering the keen contest for the seat among some senior leaders. Lok Sabha Elections in Tamil Nadu.description: NEW DELHI: Tamil Nadu goes to polls in the second phase of the seven-phase elections. Elections to 39 parliamentary seats will take place on April 18 in a single-phase polling. Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesTOP CONTENDERSThe four-cornered contest features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). This time the elections are taking place sans the Dravidian stalwarts M Karunanidhi and J Jayalalithaa. AIADMK chief Jayalalithaa passed away in December 2016 while Karunanidhi died in August 2018. While the DMK is contesting on 20 seats, the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesHOW MANY SEATS?Tamil Nadu has 39 Lok Sabha seats and one in neighbouring Puducherry. In Chhattisgarh, post on power woes draw.description: RAIPUR: Congress-ruled Chhattisgarh arrested a man for sedition under IPC 124A for a social media post on power cuts. It triggered a storm of criticism, and the charge was revoked on Friday on the orders of chief minister Bhupesh Baghel, who told police to ensure that it isn't repeated.  The controversy began with a Rajnandgaon resident, Mangilal Agrawal, posting a video of his on various social media platforms on Wednesday, criticising the Congress government for frequent interruptions in power supply in Chhattisgarh. He alleged that the power cuts were deliberate, as a ploy to boost inverter sales .  The video went viral. State power holding company chairman Shailendra Shukla forwarded it to company legal advisor N K P Singh, who advised legal action. An FIR was filed and Agrawal was arrested on Thursday. He was charged under IPC 124A for sedition and IPC 505 (intent to incite any class or community to commit offence against any other class or community). Both of them are non-bailable . What made the arrest even more controversial was that ahead of Lok Sabha election, Congress had sought votes on its pledge to abolish the British-era law.  The arrest sparked outrage on social media. "Congress had promised to repeal the sedition law, yet its government is misusing it. If spreading rumours is such a serious offence, then several Congressmen should have been put behind bars by now," said BJP MP from Rajnandgaon, Santosh Pandey.  Chief minister Bhupesh Baghel issued a statement, disapproving of the police action. Within hours, police dropped the sedition charge. Baghel said he and his government "vouch for freedom of expression".  However, Agrawal is still in custody as he faces charges under IPC 505. "Power supply is affected due to various factors, including natural causes like strong winds. But some people are spreading false information that it's due to some kind of a 'deal' with inverter companies. This is totally false," said power companies' chairman Shailendra Shukla. Chattisgarh tribals launch massive prote.description: RAIPUR: Trouble is brewing in Dantewada as a Maoist-backed agitation by tribals intensifies against mining on a hill they regard as sacred. Thousands of tribals are camping out in Kirandul, determined to protect 'jal-jangal-jameen', handing the six-month-old Congress government its biggest challenge yet. At the heart of the protest is Nandaraj Hill, which is marked as Bailadila iron ore deposit No. 13. In September last year, Adani Enterprises incorporated Bailadila Iron Ore Mining Private Ltd as a special purpose vehicle, and successfully bid for mine developer-cum-operator (MOO) for the Bailadila deposit. But villagers rose in protest against deposit No. 13 being given to the private firm, alleging it will bring about "destruction and deforestation" in the 315.8-hectare forest patch. Moreover, tribal villagers say, they have a strong religious connection with Nandaraj Hill, where they regularly go to pray. The Adani Group has issued a statement that it believes in 'growth with goodness', but the protesters refuse to budge. They gheraoed the National Mineral Development Corporation (NMDC) office on Friday, alleging that thousands of trees are already being felled. To make things more difficult for the administration, Maoists of Darbha division have thrown their weight behind the agitation. The rebels have distributed leaflets to support the tribals. Protestors threaten to block highways, railway tracksUnder the banner of ‘Gramin Panchayat Sangh Samiti’, tribals have started gathering in the thousands in Kirandul. Many of them have travelled all the way from Sukma. People from Hiroli, Benpal, Mudadi, Guniyapal have gathered in large numbers and were seen cooking food on Friday.  Police said they have not taken action so far as it’s a peaceful protest. Security is being tightened even further as police suspect Maoists are egging on the agitation. The protesters have warned that they will begin blocking trains and national highways if mining isn’t stopped. JCC, AAP and CPI leaders are supporting the protesters. Tribal leader Soni Sori and Ajit Jogi might join the protest, say sources. In a statement issued by Adani Group, a company spokesman said, “Located in South Bastar in Dantewada, Bailadila Iron Ore Deposits (natural resources) are owned by government. It is important to note that central and stateowned NCL owns these mines and Adani Enterprises Ltd only provides the support as an experienced and responsible mining contractor.”  “Adani Group strongly believes in ‘Growth with Goodness’ and this is evident from the community-oriented initiatives undertaken by its notfor-profit arm, Adani Foundation,” it said. NMDC and state PSU, Chhattisgarh Mineral Development Corporation Ltd (CMDC Ltd), formed a joint venture in 2008 to commence mining, it pointed out, adding that NMDC conducted gram sabhas between 2010 and 2014, got environment clearance in 2015 and forest clearance in January 2017. In 2017, mining lease was transferred to the government-owned joint venture company, NMDC-CMDC Ltd (NCL), the Adani Group statement goes. “In January 2018, at least 10 companies expressed interest in the international competitive bid for development and operation of Bailadila iron ore deposit No. 13. AEL was selected as successful bidder through transparent reverse bidding. In December 2018, NCL appointed AEL as mining contractor. AEL was not involved in obtaining clearances for the project and only after December 2018 it assumed role of mining contractor through transparent bidding,” it said. AP BJP List 2019.description: NEW DELHI: The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), on Thursday, announced its first candidate list for the Lok Sabha elections 2019 that includes 184 candidates. The party has named two candidates from Andhra Pradesh in the first list. Kanna Lakshminarayana will contest from Narasaraopet Lok Sabha constituency while D Purandeshwari will contest from the Visakhapatnam seat. Andhra Pradesh will go to polls in a single phase on April 11. BJP's Lok Sabha first full list The Lok Sabha elections will be held in seven phases from April 11 to May 19, 2019. The counting of the votes has been scheduled for May 23. The first phase will be held on April 11, second on April 18, third on April 23 and fourth on April 29, fifth on May 6, sixth on May 12 and seventh phase on May 19. Prime Minister Narendra Modi will contest from Varanasi constituency, while BJP president Amit Shah will fight from Gandhinagar in place of L K Advani. As many as 90 crore electors, including 1.59 crore new voters aged 18-19 years, are registered to vote in the upcoming general election. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Government teachers banned from using ph.description: RAIPUR: Collector of Balod district on Thursday banned government schoolteachers from using mobile phones in classrooms. During a review meet, collector Ranu Sahu said, regular monitoring will be done to ensure that the rule is being implemented. Disciplinary action will be taken against the teacher found to be using cell phone during class. Teachers using cell phones is a distraction for students and the no-mobile-phone in-class rule will be applicable from the upcoming session. The collector also said that a new period will be introduced in school, in which the students will be able to ask questions on subjects they are interested in. Focus would also be given on the attendance and punctuality of teachers, which will be recorded digitally, she said. The collector also reviewed issues like teachers’ problems, mid-day meal operations, uniform distribution, caste and residence certificates, scholarships among others. She directed the revenue officials to run a special campaign to issue all the necessary certificates to the students of Class 6 to 12, adding that text book distribution should also be finished by the end of this month. The officials were also instructed to pay special attention to the maintenance or repair works pending in schools, in addition to ensuring availability of drinking water and clean toilets in schools. CCTV of colonies to be linked to ITMS fo.description: RAIPUR: S mart City's state-of-the-art Integrated Traffic Management System (ITMS) will expand its monitoring services to residential colonies. For this, the feed of pre-installed CCTV cameras in residential colonies will be connected with the ITMS control room to keep a check on anti-social activities during night time. In an inspection meeting of Smart City projects, mayor Pramod Dubey directed officials to make better use of the ITMS systems which was set up in the city for the monitoring and effective management of traffic. The mayor directed officials to connect the CCTV cameras of residential colonies with the ITMS control room, so that immediate police assistance can be sent in case of emergency. Residents' sense of safety will also improve, he said.  Engineers of Raipur Municipal Corporation (RMC) will begin work to figure out the viability of connecting CCTV with ITMS control room. For this, the Resident Welfare Associations (RWAs) will be contacted to coordinate the technical upgrade of the security facility their colonies. In addition, during the meet, the mayor also reviewed the bioremediation project of 39 ponds and lakes in the city with collaboration of Bharat Heavy Electricals Limited (BHEL) and National Environment and Research Institute. The project is focused on reinstating the natural ecosystem of the water bodies - by making quality of water adequate to support life, removal of harmful aquatic weed, increase depth of the water body, reduce nutrient elements which are harmful for aquatic life, plantation of trees around the area to reverse erosion, natural air purification, among others. Arvind Kejriwal.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Delhi chief minister Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said that Congress President Rahul Gandhi has refused to forge an alliance with the AAP for the Lok Sabha polls in the national capital. Full coverage: Lok Sabha electionsTalking to reporters at the airport here, the AAP leader said he had met Gandhi recently and the Congress leader had refused to “join hands with the AAP”. Asked about Congress' Delhi unit president Sheila Dikshit's remarks that Kejriwal never approached her for an alliance, the chief minister said, “We have met Rahul Gandhi. Dikshit is not that important leader.” Kejriwal has been urging the Congress to stitch an alliance in Delhi for the Lok Sabha polls to keep the BJP away from power. Leaders in the Delhi unit of the Congress were divided over the issue of alliance with Dikshit and her three working presidents opposing it, party sources had said. A top source in the party had recently said that chances of alliance were "slim" considering its long term repercussions in Delhi. "The biggest question is how will Congress face the AAP in Assembly elections due in 2020 after the tie up. Also, the party does not gain much politically as it is being offered only 2-3 seats by Kejriwal," the source had said. Congress had drawn a blank in the 2014 parliamentary elections in Delhi. The talk of alliance was fuelled by the fact that the Congress and AAP had jointly polled more votes than the BJP that had walked away with all the seven seats in the national capital. Delhi has 7 Lok Sabha seats and it will go to polls on May 12. In Video:Congress refused to forge alliance with AAP for LS polls: KejriwalDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Husband wants a boy, woman throws her 2.description: RAIPUR: In a heart-wrenching incident, a woman threw her two daughters - one of them only a few days old - in a well as her husband had been harassing for not producing a male child. Both the children fell to their death. The incident took place in Amoda village of Janjgir-Champa district, and police have arrested the woman. A case has been lodged against the man. The woman was driven to desperation due to the constant nagging of her husband. He would insult her for not being able to deliver a son. Police said, Dhanaram Sahu and Seema had married four years ago. The couple had a daughter two years later. From then, Dhanaram would often remain angry with her. When Seema got pregnant again recently, Dhanaram had warned her of consequences that this time the baby should be a boy, she told police. On May 9, they had another daughter, and Dhanaram started abusing and thrashing her from that day onward. On Monday evening, fed up of the constant harassment, Seema picked up both her daughters and threw them in a nearby well. Neighbours informed the police and the woman was arrested. The woman confessed to throwing the children stating that her husband mentally harassed her and incited her to take the step. She told police that Dhanendra would get herbs and force feed them to her so that she conceives a boy. An FIR was lodged against him and he was arrested as well. Raipur: Juvenile rapes minor sisters, co.description: RAIPUR: The father of two raped minors, aged 8 and 5, had to run from pillar to post for 10 days to get an FIR lodged when the law says police must register a zero FIR the moment someone arrives with a complaint of sexual crime, regardless of the place of occurrence. The two sisters were raped by a 14-year-old boy on May 22 but it wasn’t until Friday that their family could file an FIR, that too after the intervention of Raipur senior SP Arif Sheikh. The accused fled during this delay and is yet to be traced. The family alleges that the inspector in charge of the local police station threatened to file a case against them if their complaint against the juvenile “turns out to be untrue”. According to the girls’ complaint they were alone at home on May 22 when the juvenile, who is a distant relative, forced himself on them. The family says he is a substance abuser. He first raped the elder girl and then turned on the five-year-old, says the complaint. When the girls informed their parents, they approached police, but were stunned to be turned away. Every time they tried to file a complaint, the officer in charge allegedly rejected it, leading them to suspect him of trying to suppress the crime. Helpless, the family wrote to collector Basva Raju, who passed it to SSP Arif Sheikh. He immediately ordered the local cops to register an FIR. When the top brass started digging into it, locals spoke of a few more cases where complaints of molestation were allegedly ignored. Raipur additional SP (rural) Tarkeshwar Patel said that an FIR was lodged against the juvenile under POCSO Act and police teams are out looking for him. Police are also investigating complaints that a friend of the accused was a habitual molester. Patel said they are patrolling the area regularly. Sonam Kapoor all praise for Raipur\u2019.description: Sonam Kapoor praises Raipur’s Oxy-Zone initiative on Twitter recently. The initiative is a growing forest area build in 18-acre area to provide respite to the citizens from pollution. Raipur wasn’t making just another statement when they said that they were “planting trees on wherever land is available,” and is creating their own microcosmic forest within the district. Omprakash Choudhary, the District Collector of Raipur, and his team are reforesting areas right at the heart of the city.  Sonam Kapoor all praise for Raipur’s Oxy-Zone Approximately 18-acres of land is being allocated to creating an ‘oxy-zone’ or a natural forest area that would provide the city its much needed breeze of cleaner air. Raipur is the seventh most polluted city in the world and this project reflects an acknowledgment that this rampant pollution has gone on for too long. The structure behind the oxy-zone was inspired by New York City’s Central Park and the city government has gone with the decision to clear plots of land worth INR 1,000 crore - all occupied by commercial projects. Romanticising chai in monsoon.description: Monsoon is here and chai-lovers of the city are making a beeline for their favourite cuppa to indugle in chit-chat and hangout sessions before the scorching summers. These chai kattas in the city are hotspots among the youngsters and an excuse to meet one another. Manohar Shukla, a BBA student from the city, says, “We have seen food trucks, but a chai katta is way cooler. Whenever I visit this place at Telibandha Lake, I can’t help but feel relax and happy, thanks to a cuppa.” On the idea behind the bus, Akshay says, “I was working with a software company in Raipur and was thinking about doing something different in the F&B industry. Kamlesh and I were contemplating a themed café at first but scrapped the idea. Suddenly, one day this idea of a chai bus struck us. Luckily, we got an old, school bus almost immediately, renovated it and turned it into a café.” The bus has a kitchen inside and though it’s in a working condition, the duo hasn’t planned to move it around yet. City-based Shoaib Shaikh, who has customised the interiors of the bus, shares, “Accommodation of furniture was a challenge, but we changed a few things and retained the feel of a state transport bus. Additionally, the outside seating has been done to resemble a bus stop. This is a place for friends as well as family to hang out.” The katta has interesting places including the famous Marine Drive around and it is the best way to unwind. Komal Aade, a chai lover adds, “All the graphics say something about chai.” The chai katta is on the must-visit list of many youngsters. Pratik Sharma, a banker who recently visited the place, says, “I had heard about the place and wanted to visit it for a while. Finally, I did. I was totally blown away by the feeling and will come back again for more.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Raipurians host sehri parties this Ramza.description: Businessman Anees Siddiqui’s home came alive at 2 am last Monday, as guests came dressed in white sherwanis, skull caps and lehengas, arrived for a party that ended after 4 am, where they were greeted by Siddiqui’s family and a big table spread comprising delectable paya, kheema, chicken and firni. This Ramzan, quite a few families in Raipur turned sehri into an opportunity for get-togethers with family and close friends. People who are fasting gathered after the late-night tarawih namaz for leisurely meals and conversations, until there was no room for another morsel. Meet and greet over scrumptious foodHomemaker Razia Bibi, who owns a business of sherwanis in town, also hosted her first-ever sehri party this year at her home. “In true Islamic tradition, we invited our Hindu friends as well. In fact, we welcomed anyone who wished to come, underprivileged or uninvited,’’ says Razia. Several families also organised potluck Sehri parties, where people brought different food items, turning the occasion into a grand feast. It’s a great way to celebrate sans stress or expenses. City-based entrepreneur Zameer Ahmed and his friends have also been organising Sehri potluck dinners at their house for the past many years. The first party this year had delectable mutton do pyaza, yakhni pulao, dahi vada, pasta, Russian salad and dates on the menu. “We all gathered post midnight, and as any gathering in Raipur is incomplete without tea and snacks, we all begin with a hot cuppa,” said Zameer, adding that the festivities went on till they couldn’t eat anymore. Adding to this, homemaker Sana Salim says they planned the menu properly before the gathering so that no dish got repeated. “The meal was savoured sitting on the floor, surrounded by the dastarkhan. It helps in improving digestion. The constant movement of bending forward to pick up the food and then returning to the sitting position activatess the muscles in the abdomen and secretes digestive juices better,” says Sana. Sehri stalls come alive tooSehri added volumes to local businesses as well. Several gravitated to the popular, where stalls supplied biryani and firnis. Vendor Syed Mohsin says, “People want fresh food for Sehri and we provide meals too, which include fancy dishes like pita bread and hummus, besides biryanis, soups and juices. These days, people are health conscious and they are opting for salads too.” “In any case, the nights of Ramzan are a time to pray, so the congregation gathers for namaz before dispersing,’’ says Anwar Khan, a professor. Making an interesting distinction between iftar parties and sehri, he says that some guests tend to wrap up iftar by 8 pm so that they can attend tarawih, while sehri starts around 11.30 pm and ends around 3.30 am-4 am. “After eating through the night, it becomes impossible for rozedars to perform the actual sehri around 4.30 am,” he explains. Satta Matka 2018.description: AGRA: Shyam Vohra, known as 'satta king' of the Taj city, was denied bail by district court of Agra. Vohra, who was arrested by the Agra police in July for his alleged involvement in betting on FIFA World Cup matches. Earlier, in April, Vohra was arrested by the Nodia STF from Greater Noida for placing bets on IPL matches, but he was granted bail. After Vohra’s arrest, Agra police booked him and his known associates including his son Vatsal, wife Rakhi, nephew Prateek, brother-in-law Kaushal and others for their alleged involvement in betting. On Monday, judge Anil Kumar Pundhir rejected Vohra’s bail plea, who was charged for attempt to murder, as he allegedly opened fire on policemen. Further, Vohra was charged for running illegal gambling racket, criminal conspiracy and obstructing policemen from executing their duties. Police are yet to arrest the relatives and associates of Vohra. Several years back, Vohra had gain notoriety for betting on cricket matches. In April, during IPL matches, the gambling racket run by Vohra had deposited Rs 62 lakh in 10 banks, after which police approached banks to freeze the amount. Even during the FIFA World Cup, Vohra collected huge amount of cash through betting. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Mamata Banerjee.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Projecting TDP supremo and AP chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu as a “national leader of importance” and keeping the debate on the alternate front prospects in the ensuing elections alive, West Bengal chief minister and Trinamool Congress chief Mamata Banerjee appealed to people of AP to elect TDP again to keep the duo of Narendra Modi and Amit Shah away from power. “Who is Modi to ask about our Prime Minister candidate? We will decide who to elect our leader as there will be alternative for Modi,” she pointed out. Mamata said Naidu has done a lot for development of Andhra Pradesh. “It’s a necessity for AP people to give the power to Naidu again as he will play a key role in national politics and show a path of development to the entire country,” she added. Addressing a public meeting convened by TDP on Sunday, Mamata said Naidu is the leader to take the country forward. “Like he has done in Andhra Pradesh, Naidu can do a lot in Delhi,” she said. Coming down heavily on Modi, Mamata appealed the gathering to save the country and remove Modi (desh ko bachana hai to Modi ko hatao). “Modi claimed to be chaiwala after 2014 elections. Now he says he is chowkidar,” she added. “But chowkidar for whom? For those who looted the country. Modi had claimed that demonitisation would mitigate terrorism and stop black money, but ironically the number of terrorist attacks was the highest in the past two years. Under Modi’s regime, more number of farmers committed suicide and unemployment increased.” She added that Modi failed to explain the Pulawama incident and the Rafale deal and spurned the demand for an all-party meeting on the issues. “The nation does not want leaders like Narendra Modi and Amit Shah,” she asserted, and challenged Modi for an open debate on a national channel of his choice to discuss issues facing the country. Satta Market.description: BHOPAL: This assembly  is turning out to be a nail-biter. The Bhopal satta bazaar that gave BJP a good chance three weeks ago is suddenly abuzz about Congress’ prospects. As per the bookies, till about a month ago, if a person placed a bet of Rs 10,000 on BJP, he would get Rs 11,000 if the party returned to power. And anyone who bet Rs 4,400 on Congress would get Rs 10,000 if the opposition wins. This week, bookies say, they are taking bets on number of seats and not on who would form the government. “In case no party gets absolute majority, or if the scoreline is too close,” explained a bookie. “We do not want to say which party will form the government. The bets are open. The satta market is running good this poll season, as it is a thrilling contest,” he added. Bookies told TOI that satta trends may not reflect the actual situation on the ground, but the market is accepting bets on 116-plus seats for Congress and 102 or more for ruling BJP. “Anyone who bets successfully on BJP or Congress will double his money,” a bookie said, adding that this trend may change just as suddenly in the next few days as campaigning gets more intense. The same bookie had told TOI around a month ago that rates may vary once candidates are finalised by the parties, “but we expect the trend to remain the same”. The satta market runs into crores in every election. Bets are placed not just over phone, but also on websites and apps, leaving almost no room for police to track down bookies and those placing bets. Probably, this is why no gang has been busted in the state so far for running an election betting racket. At least two cases of betting are registered daily in Bhopal, but the people pulling the strings of the racket in poll season are yet to be caught. Police officers say it is getting increasingly difficult to nab such gangs because they are constantly on the move. “Online betting can be operated even from a moving car, a café or any public place anywhere in the country. Those running the betting in Bhopal may be sitting anywhere on the globe,” said an officer. SP-south Rahul Kumar Lodha said a special campaign is being run against criminals involved in gambling and betting ahead of elections. “These criminals are made to sign bonds to prevent them from committing such crimes in the future. Raids are being conducted on specific tips. A list of habitual offenders is being prepared by police stations to curb such illegal activities,” he said. ASP-crime Rashmi Mishra said the crime branch has activated its network of informers prior to elections to keep an eye on betting. “It is difficult to crack online betting and gambling rackets, but police take action against criminals on specific inputs. For instance, we were tipped off on Monday night about a betting den in Kolar. It was raided but no such activity was found,” Mishra said, adding that the cyber cell is constantly on the lookout for websites and mobile apps used by betting rackets. Maoist set ablaze tendu leaves, huge cac.description: RAIPUR: Maoists in Chhattisgarh's Gariyaband district set ablaze stock of tendu leaves worth Rs 9 crore late on Tuesday. The ultras kept on hostage three guards deployed at the godown premises, and breaking the locks of one of the warehouse, they put on fire nearly 1,700 ruck sacks stuffed with tendu leaves . Police said that the incident took place in the village of Nawamguda at the warehouse where the forest produce tendu leaves are stocked up for supply. There are three godowns owned by Forest Department for storing tendu leaves. Tendu leaves are used to wrap tobacco and used as 'beedi'. Police added that more than a dozen armed Maoists appeared fromt eh darkness of forest late on Tuesday around 2330 hours and got hold of the guards on duty. While few of them kept the guards on hostage others went towards one of the three godowns with kerosene oil and match boxes. They broke open the locks and set ablaze 1700 ruck sacks full with tendu leaves. It took minutes for fire to engulf the whole godown and the dry leaves turned into ashes while the premise was gutted. The stock of leaves were worth Rs 9 crore. The rebels escaped the spot and left the guards locked inside a room to prevent them informing police immediately. After efforts of few hours, when the guards came out of the room, they informed fire brigade police and forest official and the spot of incident taken over by the fire department which was further sealed for inquiry. As it is peak of summer, the fire took long to get doused till Wednesday morning. The remaining stock of tendu leaves will be shifted to some other warehouse, police said. The Maoists also have left a leaflet that alleges the villagers who go for collection of tendu leaves in forests were not getting proper and full payment for the work they do, therefore the stock was put on fire. However, the stock belongs to a local contractor who was being questioned by the police. However, police said that efforts were being made to keep Maoists at bay who indulge in extortion of money from contractors for collection of tendu leaves, which is why the rebels were upset and have tried to create terror. The Manpur Naxal Divisional Committee is behind the incident, police said addingt hat searching was on to nab the accused. Subsequently, Gariyaband police successfully recovers a huge cache of arms and ammunition at a Maoist camp in forest. Based on input about presence of Maoists in the region, a team of district police went on an anti-Maoist operation in forests of Manpur on the mountains of Tarjhaar when they spotted a bunker of Maoists which had huge cache of arms and ammunition including an indigenous rocket launcher. Police said that two muzzle loading guns, one air gun, one country revolver, five gelatin wire, 12 bore rifle, eight live bombs and equipment to make weapons along with explosives were recovered from the spot. This shows that Maoists were present on the spot few moments ago and they might have escaped on being informed by local villagers about police approaching their camp, a police official said. Police have sounded alert int he region and the operations were intensified. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Satta King 2019.description: NEW DELHI: Satta Matka is a form of gambling or lottery that had originated before the Independence of India.Originally, the game of Matka gambling involved betting on the opening and closing rates of cotton as transmitted to the Bombay Cotton Exchange from the New York Cotton Exchange, via teleprinters.The modern-day Matka gambling/ Satta King is based on random number selection and betting. The players participating in the Satta Matka game/ gambling are required to choose the right number for winning the game. The player who wins the game becomes Satta King and is rewarded financially. Two of the most famous Matka games are - Kalyan and Worli. The Kalyan Matka gambling was started by Kalyanji Bhagat, a farmer from Gujarat, in 1962 and it ran for all days of the week. Another Matka gambling, New Worli Matka, was started by the Rattan Khatri in 1964 with slight modifications to the rules of the game. Khatri’s Matka ran only five days a week, from Monday to Friday.The modern Matka business is centred around Maharashtra.Some of the terms used in the game and their meaning is given below:    Term Meaning   Matka Matka means earthen pot that were used to draw numbers   Single Any digit between 0 and 9   Jodi/Pair Any pair of two digits between 00 and 99    Patti/Panna Three digit number    Open result / close result Outcome of matka betting   Berij Berij is last digit of jodi's/pair's sum The Google 2018 trends data shows that 'satta' and 'matka' were the top searched words in the Madhya Pradesh state in the year 2018. As per the Google data, 'satta' was the 4th most searched word with a score of 36 and 'matka' came 6th with a score of 23.Any form of Satta Matka gambling is illegal in India.Disclaimer: This content is for reference purpose only and The Times of India claims no ownership of this content. The Times of India does not support or promote piracy in any manner.Download The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

Former BSF jawan trampled to death by ju.description: JASHPUR: A retired Border Security Force jawan was trampled to death by a herd of wild elephants in Jashpur district, an official said Wednesday. The incident took place on Tuesday night when the victim, Tyofil Tirky (55), was walking towards his home in Dabkala village under Tapkara forest range bordering with Odisha after attending a family function nearby, divisional forest officer Krishna Kumar Jadhav said. Suddenly, a herd of elephants appeared there and attacked him. The jumbos smashed the man on the ground with their trunks before trampling him to death, he said. "Tirky, a retired Border Security Force (BSF) man, died on the spot. On getting information, the forest personnel reached there and sent the body for post-mortem," he said. The kin of the deceased have been provided an instant relief amount of Rs25,000, the official said. The herd of elephants entered into Tapkara area from neighbouring Odisha, he said, adding that forest personnel have been directed to keep a tab on the tuskers' movement to prevent any untoward incident further. The Tapkara region here shares border with Odisha and Jharkhand states and the dense forest at this tri-junction is a prime habitat of elephants. Forest officials from Jharkhand and Odisha have also been asked to share inputs about the cross-border movement of elephants so that a strategy can be chalked out to check man-animal conflict, Jadhav said. On May 3, two villagers were killed in separate incidents of elephant attack in Kunkuri forest area here. Several incidents of human-elephant conflict have been reported in the past from the thick forested northern Chhattisgarh, consisting of Surguja, Surajpur, Korba, Raigarh, Jashpur, Balrampur and Korea districts. The region has witnessed several killings of tribals and widespread damage to houses and crops by rogue elephants. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Three colleges get MCI nod for MBBS cour.description: RAIPUR: The Indian Medical Council of India (MCI) has given its nod to medical colleges of Rajnandgaon and Jagdalpur to run courses for 100 MBBS seats each. The Raigarh medical college has also got the nod for MBBS course on 50 seats. According to reports, after the Ambikapur Medical College failed to get the MCI approval for 2019-20 due to shortage of faculty and infrastructure, there were speculations that even Raigarh college will be deprived of the nod, as it also has shortage of faculties and infrastructure. Now, the officials of the Department Medical Education (DME) are in process of appealing to the Union health ministry to reconsider the decision to approve 100 medical seats for Ambikapur Medical College. Ambikapur Medical College has received 'zero year' twice in the past four years. This means the college is not entitled to offer MBBS course. A week ago, Durg-based Chandulal Chandrakar medical college was declared 'zero year' by the MCI. Though this college has 150 MBBS seats, it has received 'zero year' for the second consecutive year. Due to zero year, these colleges have deprived 250 medical seats in the state, said DME official. Chhattisgarh has total 1100 MBBS seats, including 650 in six government-run medical colleges and 450 in three private colleges. The government-run Raipur Medical College and private colleges like Shri Shankaracharya Institute of Medical Sciences and Raipur Institute of Medical Sciences (RIMS) have received MCI approval to run MBBS course for 2019-20. Two medical colleges of Bilaspur and Raigarh are still awaiting MCI nod for 150 and 50 medical seats respectively,. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Chhattisgarh: Bijapur collector imposes.description: BIJAPUR: The collector of Chhattisgarh's Bijapur district Tuesday barred government staff from wearing "T-shirts, jeans and clothes with provocative colours" to office. In a circular issued here, Collector KD Kunjam said officials and employees were to attend office in formals or prescribed uniforms, an official said. "It is being noticed officials and employees of the district administration have been wearing T-shirts, jeans and clothes with provocative colours in place of formals to office. As per rules, government personnel should wear clothes which are simple in appearance," the order said. It said some Class IV employees were not wearing designated uniforms while at work despite claiming uniform and washing allowance, it added. "Officials and employees of district administration should come to office in formal and simple dresses and class four employees in their uniforms," it said. BJP neta held for 'fraud' in Jashpur.description: RAIPUR: Cops arrested a BJP leader, who allegedly transferred compensation money from lands belonging to tribals by using fraudulent means in Jashpur district last year. Pathalgaon SDOP Abhishek Jha told TOI that the accused has been identified as Shyam Narayan Gupta, who is a BJP corporator at ward number 12 of Pathalgaon Nagar Panchayat in Jashpur district. The accused hoodwinked the tribals and fraudulently transferred the compensation money amounting to Rs28 that was meant for the beneficiaries. During investigation, police found that the accused was continuously changing his location and he was finally nabbed with the help of mobile phone location. When cops reached his location, he hid in a house which was locked from the outside. Many tribal families had lodged complaints with the Jashpur collector alleging that the BJP leader with the help of bank authorities had fraudulently swindled Rs28 lakh out of the total Rs49 lakh compensation for their lands, which were acquired by the administration. Cops had lodged cases under Section 420,467,468,120B of the IPC. Police said other accused in the case will be nabbed at the earliest. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Amit Jogi lodges complaint against Chhat.description: RAIPUR: Former chief minister Ajit Jogi’s son Amit, who is the president of regional party Janata Congress Chhattisgarh, has lodged a complaint with the police and is also planning to write to National Commission for Women (NCW) against chief minister Bhupesh Baghel for 'insulting his mother'. The controversy seems to have started with Amit Jogi questioning Baghel over his 'closed-door meet' with Adani Group officials in Delhi, and asking if he sold off the state’s mines. Baghel shot back that as CM he has to meet people, and if he should make public his discussions with Amit’s mother Renu Jogi as well. Amit Jogi in a series of tweets claimed that chief minister Bhupesh Baghel had a closed door meeting with senior officials of Adani Group during his recent visit to Delhi, urging him to make public the discussions which he had with the Adani Group. Replying to Jogi’s statement, chief minister Bhupesh Baghel said “whosoever the CM meets come out in public and there's no reason to hide.” Baghel added that he had also met Amit's legislator mother Renu Jogi alone as a politician and does he want that the conversation should be made public? After Baghel’s remarks, JCC leader Amit Jogi said that the CM was unnecessarily dragging the senior most woman legislator of Chhattisgarh into the controversy in order to vent out his frustration on his mother. Amit Jogi said, “We have filed a complaint with the Civil Lines police station against chief minister Bhupesh Baghel for his remarks against senior legislator Renu Jogi saying that the tone in which Baghel spoke about Mrs Jogi was insulting and derogatory to the entire womanhood. What does Baghel mean by ‘meeting her alone’? Having faith in law I will further write a complaint to National Commission for Women’s Rights as well against the chief minister.” Amit in his tweet had said that Baghel had met the Adani group officials on June 14 between 6-8pm at Chhattisgarh Bhawan in New Delhi and Baghel should make the conversation he did with them public. Last week, tribals in Bastar had strongly protested against Adani Group proposed mine developer and operator (MDO) project for extraction of iron ore from deposit number 13 at Bailadila. Subsequently, the state government had put on hold the pre-mining activity, including cutting down of trees, being carried out by joint NCL limited, a joint venture of NMDC and Chhattisgarh Mineral Development corporation. Chief minister Bhupesh Baghel later issued a statement saying, “I respect and adore Renu Jogi and I have simply asked Amit if he wants me to make the conversation I had with her open in public, I can.” The way Amit has misrepresented it shows his immaturity in politics and I condemn such behaviour and indecent remarks made in public, CM said. Chhattisgarh: Police informer hacked to.description: JAGDALPUR: A police informer was hacked to death by suspected Maoists in Bastar district of Chhattisgarh, police said Sunday. The incident occurred late Saturday night when the deceased, identified as Chhannu Sodhi (30), was on a visit to Bastanar weekly market under Kodenar police station area of the district, a local police official said. Sodhi was attacked by a 'small action team' of Maoists (typically comprising four-five cadres) with axes, leaving him dead on the spot, he said. Soon after being alerted, a police team was rushed to the spot and the body was brought for the post-mortem, the official said, adding that a search operation was launched in the area to trace the assailants. Sodhi was working as 'gopaniya sainik' (secret police informer), who are appointed by district superintendent of police at local level for anti-Maoist operations, especially for gathering intelligence. Mostly surrendered cadres work as police informers, but Sodhi had not been associated with the outlawed Maoists, the official added. According to police, Sodhi was working in Katekalyan police station area of neighbouring Dantewada district and became a victim of a Maoist trap. "Maoists had recently put up pamphlets in its Darbha division and other places and tried to lure their surrendered colleagues, who are now working as assistant police constables and informers, to return to their villages and stop helping security forces," Dantewada superintendent of police Abhishek Pallava told PTI. Maoists had claimed that those who return to their villages will be given lands and houses, a promise which was nothing but a ploy. Sodhi fell into this trap and returned to his village without informing police, he said. "I had warned Sodhi and other assistant constables, mostly recruited in District Reserve Guard (DRG) - state's anti-Maoist force, and police informers that they should not get influenced by the Maoist conspiracy and should not return to their villages," Pallava added. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Ushoshi Sengupta.description: KOLKATA: A gang of 10 bikers chased around Kolkata-based model Ushoshi Sengupta’s app cab through the streets of south Kolkata and harassed her — not once but twice — late on Monday night. The last round of harassment occurred after cops at a police station “refused to register her complaint” but, instead, referred her to the “right police station”.   Cops from Bhowanipore arrived around 10-15 minutes later. It was past midnight by then and Sengupta decided to pursue the case on Tuesday morning and requested the cabby to drop her colleague and her off at their homes. But the nightmare was far from being over. “The boys had followed us till my colleague’s house and, right when we were dropping him at Lake Gardens, six of them on three bikes came and stopped the car. They pelted stones, smashing the window. They then dragged me out and tried to break my phone to delete the video. Luckily, local people heard my cries for help and came out. The boys then fled,” Sengupta recalled.   She then called her father and sister; her own residence was just a lane away. They called cops, who came and asked her to file an FIR at the Charu Market police station. It was 1.30 a.m. when she reached there but, instead of taking down her complaint, the cops there directed her to Bhowanipore police station where the first assault had occured. “I just gave up and started shouting at this point. There was no female police officer. The officer there finally took down my complaint after asking a lot of questions but refused to take the cabby’s complaint, stating that two FIR could not be taken for the same incident,” she said. Frustrated and hapless, she returned home. It was at 2.30 p.m. on Tuesday that she posted the entire ordeal on Facebook along with a 20-second video clip. An additional CP later called Sengupta and assured her of strong action against not just the accused but an inquiry into police refusal to take her complaint citing jurisdiction issues. “The probe has just begun and we have identified all the culprits. More arrests are likely and we will probe whether there was lack of adequate response from cops,” said a Lalbazar official. The arrested were identified as Sheikh Rahit, Fardeen Khan, Sheikh Shabir Ali, Sheikh Gani, Sheikh Imran Ali, Sheikh Wasim and Atif Khan alias Md Samsad. A preliminary inquiry revealed the cab had accidentally brushed against the bike, causing the riders to lose balance. One of the bikes’ rear view mirrors broke and the youths accosted cabby Tarak Debnath to demand compensation. At least two more bikes and an auto carrying more people landed there, leading to the sequence of events ending with the assault at Lake Gardens, officials said. Two held for forgery, duping businessman.description: RAIPUR: Two persons were arrested from Mumbai for allegedly duping a Raipur businessman of Rs 13 lakh by fraudulently registering the trademark of his company in his name. Police said, Manoj Sachdeva of Fafadih locality in Raipur owns a plastic scientific equipment company - M/s Sachdeva Scientific Equipment Pvt Ltd situated at Baloda Bazaar Road. His factory is in operation since 2014. He hired the accused Haresh Purohit and Girish Purohit as manufacturing head and director soon after. Taking advantage of Sachdeva's faith in them, the accused registered the 'Casablanca' trademark of his company in their own name and ever since then have been supplying manufactured goods in the market under a brand owned by them, minting crores and causing losses to Sachdeva. This is in addition to the Rs13 lakhs. In April, the accused told Sachdeva, that the moulds used for manufacturing various equipment need maintenance and repair, and they sent them to a Mumbai-based firm. On May 2 the accused took the repaired moulds worth Rs13 lakhs from the firm and fled. Sachdeva came to know about the swindle only after a telephonic conversation with the owner of the Mumbai firm. Stunned by the fraudulence of his employees, Sachdeva launched an audit of the accounts of his firm while simultaneously tracing the absconding duo. It is then he found that they had registered his company's trademark under their name. Sachdeva lodged a complaint against them in Kharora police station following which an offence under Section 420,408 IPC was registered against both. A manhunt was launched with the help of Cyber Cell. A few days ago, their location was traced to Kandivali (East) area of Mumbai. A police team was sent to Mumbai and the accused were taken into custody. They have been brought to the city under transit remand. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Om Birla.description: NEW DELHI: The BJP's surprise pick — Om Birla — is all set to become the next Lok Sabha Speaker after his candidature on Tuesday was backed by all NDA allies as also by the YSR Congress Party, the Biju Janata Dal and key opposition parties, including the Congress. A notice was given to the Lok Sabha Secretariat by the BJP, proposing the name of Birla, a two-time MP from Kota-Bundi seat in Rajasthan, for the Speaker's post and bringing a motion for his election, which will be held on Wednesday. As per sources, Prime Minister Narendra Modi proposed 57-year-old Birla's name for the post. The Rajasthan leader is considered to be close to both Modi and BJP president Amit Shah. 10 parties extend support to Om Birla's candidature for Lok Sabha speaker: Prahlad JoshiBirla's surprise nomination is seen by many in the BJP as a message from the top leadership that the party will promote leaders who keep a low-profile and work at the ground-level. BJD, YSRCP, JDU, Shiv Sena, Akali Dal, National People's Party, Mizo National Front, Lok Janshakti Party, AIADMK and Apna Dal have given the notice to support Birla's candidature for the Speaker's post, parliamentary affairs minister Pralhad Joshi told reporters. Later, Congress leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury said the party and the UPA allies have also decided to support the candidature of Birla as the Speaker. Chowdhury also said the Congress has already moved a motion supporting the ruling party candidate. The decision to support Birla's nomination was taken at a meeting of the UPA allies, where the leaders also discussed the opposition strategy during Parliament session. Birla won his first Lok Sabha election in 2014 and was re-elected from Rajasthan's Kota-Bundi seat. He defeated Congress's Ramnaraian Meena with a margin of over 2.5 lakh votes in the recently concluded general election. He has also been elected to Rajasthan assembly for three consecutive terms in 2003, 2008 and 2013. Birla will succeed eight-term MP Sumitra Mahajan as the Speaker, a post traditionally held by senior MPs. However, this will not be for the first time a relative newcomer will hold the position. In 1996, TDP leader G M C Balayogi was also a two-time MP when he was elected as the LS Speaker and after his death in a helicopter crash in 2002, Shiv Sena leader and the first-time MP Manohar Joshi was appointed to the position. Download The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

Raipur celebrates Eid-ul-Fitr with famil.description: After a month of fasting, the city is ready to soak itself in the fervour of Eid-ul-Fitr today. While thousands of believers will offer prayers at the beautifully decked up mosques and idgahs of Raipur; at home, friends and family will exchange greetings and gifts along with warm embraces and grand feasts. Mention Eid, and the first thing come to mind is sheer khurma. Each family has its own recipe for this dessert, which is an integral part of the celebrations. Trying her hand for the first time in preparing the dish today is Bushra Ansari, an MBA student. She says, “I am preparing sheer khurma for the first time for family and friends, and I will be following an age-old family recipe handed down to me by my family. It is a huge responsibility for me, which I can’t afford to go wrong with, as I am expecting over 50 visitors at home today. Interestingly, more than our close relatives and family, it is our non-Muslim friends who visit our place during this festival.” “We exchange love and greetings, with a warm bowl of sheer khurma,” says Bushra. Youngsters can’t wait to get eidi from the elders today, as most of them buy their favourite things with the collected money. However, entrepreneur Ahsan Ali and his friends are planning something special this year. “Getting eidi from the elders in the family and neighbourhood is like accepting their blessings. And today, my friends and I decided to share our blessings with underprivileged children. We plan to use our eidi to buy clothes and sewayian for the kids. We also to pack homemade biryani for them. Eid is one occasion where we share our joys with everyone.” Eid is also that special time when everyone in the family comes together in celebration. And so, it is also a time for homecoming for many. Teacher Sumaira Ali has come to Raipur from Dubai to celebrate Eid with her family. She says, “I can’t contain my enthusiasm as I speak. Eid is a very special occasion and when celebrated with family and friends, it feels complete. The simple joys of having hearty meals at home and meeting friends fill the day with love. Also, we share biryani with the people of our neighbourhood. It’s been our family tradition for over 100 years.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Chandrababu Naidu.description: KURNOOL: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday launched a blistering attack on Andhra Pradesh chief minister and erstwhile ally N Chandrababu Naidu, calling him 'u-turn Babu', whose "intent" was not on state's development. Addressing a well-attended election rally here, he sought to reject Naidu's repeated attacks that his government neglected the state. Andhra Pradesh goes to siumultaneous elections to the 175-member assembly and 25 Lok Sabha seats in the first phase on April 11 with the BJP contesting them alone. Listing various initiatives taken by the NDA government for Andhra Pradesh, Modi said it was during his regime that the Vizag-Chennai industrial corridor was flagged off and approval for the first National Institute of Ocean Technology (NIOT) given. It was also the 'chowkidar' who cleared the first Indian Institute of Packaging (IIP) besides approving the greenfield petrochemical complex for the state, he said. "Five years ago, your one vote made me PM. Your Pradhan sewak worked selflessly day and night for the people of the country. Chowkidar kept the interest of the state in mind," he said. Modi also recalled that the NDA government sanctioned first central university in Anantpur. He accused Naidu, the Telugu Desam Party supremo, of pasting state government 'stickers' on the Central schemes. "For sure, I could have done more work. I just required the cooperation of the state government. I made all efforts from my side, but the person who is running the government (Naidu), his intention is not Andhra Pradesh's development," Modi said. Levelling charges of corruption and dynasty politics against Naidu, he said the election date of April 11 will usher in the "double engine" of the state's growth -- a BJP government both at the Centre and the state. There was debate going on in AP that there were 'schemes for corruption,' ranging from the creation of the new capital Amravati, the Prime Minister charged. "The people of Andhra Pradhesh know whose coffers are being filled.. when this chowkidar sought accounts, u-turn Babu took a u-turn from AP's growth and walked out from NDA," Modi lashed out. Naidu had snapped ties with the NDA in March last year, accusing the Centre of not honouring the "promised" special category status to Andhra Pradesh. Hitting out at the TDP supremo for getting close to the Congress, Modi said Naidu has "found friends who are on bail," apparently referring to Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Sonia Gandhi who are on bail in the National Herald case. Modi, who had in the past hit out at Naidu for alleged family politics, said the election should also see the "son set", and called for a new "sun rise." He deliberately stressed on the "son" part to drive home his point on dynasty politics targeting the AP chief minister and his son and state minister Nara Lokesh. Without elaborating, Modi mocked that Pakistan has now accepted Naidu's "friends" as "hero." Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

\nAgarwal group marks the beginning of i.description: With a spectacular event on Friday, Agarwal group marked the beginning of its three-day-long opening ceremony at the Naya Raipur campus. The ceremony started with the Sarawati Vandana followed by principal Nilofar Jahan talking about Agarwal School’s history and its achievements. Piyush Agarwal, Purushottam Agarwal’s son, then addressed the audience, talking of the group’s vision and journey to the Raipur campus and their aspirations in its regard. He said, “The campuses at Shankar Nagar and Naya Raipur were given as a project to me. Our vision for the school is to educate children using the ‘learn by fun’ methodology. Apart from the main school building, we have indoor swimming, various sports clubs and the best facilities on campus. The campus is fully developed and ready to welcome students for this session.”In an interactive session held at Naya Raipur campus, Purushottam, chairman of Agarwal Group, put forward his ideas about the present education system, saying, “I have always trained my faculty to pay equal attention to theory and practicals. The syllabus especially focuses on practical application of the subject. The concept of ‘learn by fun’ is all about this. Our 20-year tenure in the field of education has been a success and my vision is to produce students with high morals and indepth knowledge of the subject.” He also expressed his concern over the degrading quality of education and corrupt system that gives students false degrees and hope without providing them with proper training and skills. He then shared his motivational journey from being a fourth-standard pass to an industrialist. He also made note of how fast Raipur is developing called it one of the most beautiful Indian cities. “I have struggled my way through all the ups and downs without sacrificing my morals. Honesty and hardwork is what saw me through,” he added.Post the speech, Vande Mataram, a patriotic play that left the audience spellbound, was staged by artists from Vishala Sanskritik Committee, Madhya Pradesh. The play opened with the Indian flag flying high, telling the story of the struggle for freedom, from 1857 to present day. The happiness of the Indians before their capture by East India Company was perfectly shown via dance. The captivating background and dialogue beautifully expressed each emotion, from pain to pleasure. The Kakori Conspiracy was especially elaborated in the play. The 90-minute-long play covered the struggle of all the freedom fighters, culminating with the message mile sur mera tumhara to sur bane humara.The Shankar Nagar campus was inaugurated yesterday at 11 am by Guru Shri Swami Awdheshanand Ji followed by Swamji’s words. “Education is one of the most important aspects of life. Ignorance is the root cause of all pain and education leads a person from lies to truth, darkness to light,” he said. Swamiji also stressed on the letters and words in everyday life and how knowledge can change a person.— Prachi SahuDownload The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Pawan Kalyan.description: GUNTUR: Stating that they will bulldoze bastions of TDP and YSR Congress, Janasena president Pawan Kalyan promised to grant Rs 5,000 pension to all farmers in the state. He said they will also grant Rs 8,000 crop incentive to farmers soon after coming into power in the next elections. Pawan further said his government would provide six to 10 LPG cylinders free-of-cost to each family every year. and also promised to fill 3 lakh vacancies in the government departments to provide jobs to youth. Addressing a meeting in Guntur on Monday, Pawan said that the future of the state did not mean the future of Lokesh and Jagan but it was the future of the people. “The space on the state’s political stage is not TDP’s and YSRC’s property as youth and women are eager to bring change through Jana Sena.” “TDP had lost moral right to rule the state as chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu had no control over his legislators who indulged in illegal activities,” Pawan said adding that he jumped into the political arena to bring in a change in the lives of commoners. “We supported TDP and BJP in the last elections with a hope to transform the state. Unfortunately, both of them have shattered our dreams,” he said. “Guntur city has been left in a lurch despite located a few kilometres away from the capital city. The entire city has been dug out in the guise of laying underground drainage scheme and left without repair. How shocking it is to see 30 people dying of diarrhoea in a city like Guntur? Is it not the failure of the state government? Opposition leader Jaganmohan Reddy is equally responsible for the tragedy as he never dared to question the government by going to the assembly,” he said. He further said they would construct apartments exclusively for Muslims in the city. He appealed to people to support his candidates Chandrasekhar (Guntur West), Zia-Ur-Rehman (East) and MP candidate Bonaboina Srinivas Yadav in the elections, Pawan said they fielded a BC candidate Srinivasa Yadav whereas TDP and YSRC both have given tickets to their own communities.
